text: I really want to understand when and why things precompile. I am frustrated of waiting for  precompilation of the same plotting libraries for each script/experiment/plot.

elements.text: I really want to understand when and why things precompile. I am frustrated of waiting for  precompilation of the same plotting libraries for each script/experiment/plot.

text: IMO, we *really* need a “per-environment caching” or something like that. On the one hand, one is inclined to use environments as much as possible (i.e. one is supposed to think of them as “low-cost”). On the other hand, switching between environments can easily trigger re-precompilation if the same package is in both environments (which makes them “high-cost” effectively).

elements.text: need a “per-environment caching” or something like that. On the one hand, one is inclined to use environments as much as possible (i.e. one is supposed to think of them as “low-cost”). On the other hand, switching between environments can easily trigger re-precompilation if the same package is in both environments (which makes them “high-cost” effectively).

text: I thought we had that as of one of the minor releases

elements.text: I thought we had that as of one of the minor releases

text: <@U67D54KS8>  added per environment caching in julia 1.3. iirc

elements.text: added per environment caching in julia 1.3. iirc

text: And since 1.3 I haven't seen recompilation triggered just from changing environments

elements.text: And since 1.3 I haven't seen recompilation triggered just from changing environments

text: When none of the existing cache files matches with what is needed. It can be due to another julia version being used, another version of a dependency being used, etc

elements.text: When none of the existing cache files matches with what is needed. It can be due to another julia version being used, another version of a dependency being used, etc

text: So how is decided if the environment uses a newer version ?

elements.text: So how is decided if the environment uses a newer version ?
